articles.author: Kayla Rivas
articles.title: CDC director OKs COVID-19 booster shot for some Americans with weak immune systems - Fox News
articles.description: Dr. Rochelle Walensky, director of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), has upheld a vote by a panel of independent experts that moderate-to-severe immunocompromised individuals may receive a Pfizer or Moderna COVID-19 booster shot.
articles.content: Dr. Rochelle Walensky, the director of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), upheld a vote Friday by a panel of independent experts that moderate-to-severe immunocompromised individua… [+2491 chars]

articles.author: Luke Sharrett
articles.title: America's state-spanning 1110km jumble sale runs from the Deep South to Canada - Independent.ie
articles.description: Arguably the biggest bargain hunt anywhere, the ‘Route 127 Yard Sale’ (jumble sale) stretches clear across America. Starting in the Deep South, the annual event runs 1,110 kilometres to within a few hours’ drive of Canada.

articles.author: Sporting News
articles.title: Presiden LaLiga Javier Tebas: Barcelona Tolak Kesempatan Pertahankan Lionel Messi - Goal.com
articles.description: Teenage American fullback Joe Scally put in a standout performance in his Bundesliga debut for Borussia Monchengladbach and it came against star-studded Bayern Munich.

articles.title: A FIFTH of Americans believe in COVID-19 vaccination misinformation including that it alters DNA - nation.lk - The Nation Newspaper
articles.description: A Harvard University study finds that one out of every five Americans believes at least one piece of vaccine misinformation. Lies about vaccines have become rampant on social media over the past months.
articles.content:
One-fifth of Americans believe at least one common piece of misinformation about the COVID-19 vaccines, a new study finds.
